overview: From 2025-10-12 to 2025-10-13, elizaos-plugins/plugin-anthropic had 2 new PRs (2 merged), 0 new issues, and 2 active contributors.

topPRs.title: refactor: restructure plugin files
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
- Split monolithic index.ts into modular directory structure
- Created models/ directory with separate text.ts and object.ts handlers
- Created providers/ directory with anthropic client factory
- Created utils/ directory with config, events, and json utilities
- Added types/ directory for clean type exports
- Implemented background API key validation in init.ts
- Added model usage event emission for telemetry
- Enhanced test suite with 6 E2E tests including API key validation
- All tests passing: 14 unit tests + 6 E2E tests

This refactoring improves code maintainability, follows established patterns
from plugin-openai, and makes the codebase easier to navigate and extend.

Breaking changes: None - all existing functionality preserved

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Restructures the Anthropic plugin into modular files (providers, models, utils, init), adds base URL config, background API key validation, usage telemetry events, and refines tests.
> 
> - **Core Refactor**:
>   - Split monolithic `src/index.ts` into modular structure:
>     - `src/models/` (`text.ts`, `object.ts`) for `TEXT_*` and `OBJECT_*` handlers
>     - `src/providers/` (`anthropic.ts`) with `createAnthropicClient`
>     - `src/utils/` (`config.ts`, `events.ts`, `json.ts`, `index.ts`) for settings, telemetry events, JSON parsing
>     - `src/init.ts` for background config/API key validation
>     - `src/types/` exporting JSON-related types
>   - Plugin now imports handlers (`handleTextSmall/large`, `handleObjectSmall/large`) and exports `./types`.
> - **Configuration**:
>   - Added `ANTHROPIC_BASE_URL` and `ANTHROPIC_BROWSER_BASE_URL` support; browser builds avoid API keys.
>   - Experimental telemetry flag wired via `getExperimentalTelemetry`.
> - **Telemetry**:
>   - Emit model usage events via `emitModelUsageEvent` with token counts.
> - **Tests**:
>   - Expanded tests including API key validation and object generation scenarios.
> - **Misc**:
>   - Version bump to `1.5.11`.
>   - Minor README formatting tweak and `.gitignore` updates.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 3c45a951be3d86c000bf9eb25dcdb10767ec3b52. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Added reliable JSON object generation and new text handlers.
  - Introduced configurable Anthropic client with environment-aware settings.
  - Emitted usage telemetry events; expanded public types.
- Refactor
  - Modularized model handlers and initialization with browser-aware behavior and softer missing-key warnings.
- Documentation
  - Improved README formatting for readability.
- Style
  - Standardized string quotes and minor log formatting.
- Chores
  - Bumped version to 1.5.11.
  - Updated ignore patterns.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: fix: add @types/node to resolve TypeScript compilation errors
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
- Added @types/node as a devDependency to provide Node.js type definitions
- Added "types": ["node"] to tsconfig.json compiler options
- Fixes TypeScript errors for process.env usage in src/index.ts and src/utils/config.ts
- Resolves build failure during declaration generation step

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Add Node.js type definitions to TypeScript config and devDeps; bump @elizaos/core and package version.
> 
> - **Build/TypeScript**:
>   - Add `@types/node` to `devDependencies` and include `"types": ["node"]` in `tsconfig.json`.
> - **Dependencies/Versioning**:
>   - Bump `@elizaos/core` to `^1.6.1`.
>   - Increment package version to `1.5.12`.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit c8d7a37049f6cee63d7be27d51fac6602b7b6baf. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **Chores**
  * Version bumped to 1.5.12.
  * Updated internal dependencies to latest compatible versions for maintenance and stability.
  * Added Node type definitions for development and included them in the TypeScript configuration to improve editor tooling and type safety.
  * No user-facing changes; runtime behavior and public API remain unchanged.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
